messages.message:
@Arjun I see the casing fix on sandbox, but not UAT, so just want to confirm that this is indeed making it in 23.49?

Also, my bad for being wishy-washy above... Now that I look at this UI again, I really think we should use "Project confidence threshold" instead of "Default confidence threshold". Is this do-able?
I am also not seeing this on UAT which is strange — let me follow up and figure out why it isn’t on UAT (it should be)
and that’s my bad on not updating that last spot of copy — will do
Thank you! Please let me know when you're able to confirm fix version.
@melissa.amos it seems to be on UAT now
maybe just need to hard refresh

I see it now!

Here's what I'm thinking for the project confidence threshold. I'll assume this won't make 23.49 unless you tell me otherwise.
should the first image you sent also be “Project confidence threshold”?
or is there a reason to have that one be different?'

I debated. It's the same string as a field-specific threshold. I think we're creating a _rule_ based on _model confidence_ that applies to either a project or a field. I think the applicability is conveyed by context, and it doesn't need to be reiterated in the dropdown?
I don't feel strongly though. If you want to do _Project model confidence_ for that first screenshot, I approve.
If we start adding other types of project-wide rules though... are we gonna want to include "project" in all of them? It'll seem redundant.
that reasoning makes sense to me!
